pr_title: Update readme and changelog for preview 3 release

timeline.message: Update readme and changelog for preview 3 release

timeline.bodyText: This is already included in the Next Steps section, do we need add it again?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -156,6 +156,8 @@ for (SearchResult result : indexClient.search("luxury hotel",
 }
 ```
 
+- Samples are explained in detail [here][samples_readme].

replies.bodyText: This is the feedback from readme review meeting.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Interesting, I believe we removed this in the past for the same reason. I'm okay with duplicating it than.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't need to include this here as this is coming through from Azure Core and the Netty module. If you do want to include it remove the bit about Netty as the clients are HTTP transport agnostic.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,7 +1,10 @@
 # Release History
 
-## 1.0.0-beta.3 (Unreleased)
-- Change `createOrUpdate*` and `delete*` APIs in `SearchServiceClient` to use boolean `onlyIfUnchanged` instead of `MatchConditioans`.
+## 1.0.0-beta.3 (2020-05-05)
+- Replaced `isRetrievable` API to `isHidden`. Boolean value flips over from `retrievable` to `hidden`.
+- Changed search version from `2019-05-06` to `2019-05-06-Preview`
+- Changed `createOrUpdate*` and `delete*` APIs in `SearchServiceClient` to use boolean `onlyIfUnchanged` instead of `MatchConditioans`.
+- Updated reactor core to `3.3.5.RELEASE` and reactor netty to `0.9.7.0.9.7.RELEASE`

timeline.bodyText:

            - Changed `createOrUpdate*` and `delete*` APIs in `SearchServiceClient` to use boolean `onlyIfUnchanged` instead of `MatchConditioans`.
          
          
            
            - Changed `createOrUpdate` and `delete` APIs in `SearchServiceClient` to use boolean `onlyIfUnchanged` instead of `MatchConditions`.

timeline.bodyText: Remove en-us from all docs.microsoft.com links. It'll redirect users to a version according to their locale.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,12 +39,12 @@ The SDK provides two clients.
 
 #### Create a SearchServiceClient
 
-Once you have the values of the Cognitive Search Service [URL endpoint](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/search-create-service-portal#get-a-key-and-url-endpoint) 
-and [admin key](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/search-security-api-keys) you can create the Search Service client:
+Once you have the values of the Azure Cognitive Search service [URL endpoint](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/search-create-service-portal#get-a-key-and-url-endpoint)

-Create Index using `SearchIndexClient` create in above [section](Create-a-SearchIndexClient)

replies.bodyText:
Oh. I understand.
"
Create an index using the searchServiceClient instantiated in "Create a SearchServiceClient".
